meanings.definition: A person or thing that corresponds to or has the same function as another person or thing.
meanings.sent1: In the play, the evil queen had her counterparts in the form of the wicked stepmother.
meanings.sent2: Doctors and nurses are counterparts in the hospital, working together to care for patients.
meanings.sent3: The counterparts of the detective were his loyal sidekicks, always ready to solve mysteries.
meanings.sent4: In the world of superheroes, every hero has their counterpart, a villain with similar powers.
meanings.sent5: The counterparts of the king were his advisors, guiding him in times of need.

meanings.definition: One of two parts that fit, complete, or complement each other.
meanings.sent1: The key and the lock are counterparts, each essential for opening the door.
meanings.sent2: The puzzle pieces were counterparts, fitting together perfectly to reveal the picture.
meanings.sent3: The peanut butter and jelly were counterparts in the sandwich, creating a delicious combination.
meanings.sent4: In music, the melody and harmony are counterparts, blending to create beautiful compositions.
meanings.sent5: The wheels of a bicycle are counterparts, working together to propel the rider forward.
